title: Iran ready to discuss compromises to reach nuclear deal, minister tells BBC in Tehran
partialText: Majid Takht-Ravanchi, Iran's deputy foreign minister, tells the BBC's Lyse Doucet that the ball was "in America's court to prove that they want to do a deal".

title: Europe must be ready to fight, PM tells Munich Security Conference
partialText: The prime minister's speech comes after a tumultuous week in his political career back home.

title: 'Trump will be gone in three years': Top US Democrats try to reassure Europe
partialText: Opposition politicians flocked to a summit in Munich to offer an alternative to America First - and stake a claim as future party leaders.

title: Children 'weaponised' by both sides of trans debate, says author of report into gender identity services
partialText: Clinician Dr Hilary Cass says "people at the extremes" had caused a lot of distress for young people.

title: Obama addresses racist video shared by Trump depicting him as an ape
partialText: The former US president didn't name Trump, but lamented the lack of "shame" and "decorum" among public officials.

title: Death of the sex drive - and the great debate over whether testosterone can help get it back
partialText: Can boosting testosterone improve libido, or is much of the attention solely hype, profit, and placebo?

title: Could Manchester be a model for the UK to kickstart growth?
partialText: With an annual growth rate of 3.1%, Manchester's economy has performed twice as well as that of the UK as a whole.

title: GB women shock curling world champions Canada
partialText: Great Britain's women curlers kickstart their campaign with a superb first victory of the 2026 Winter Olympics while GB's men also won but three British women missed out on skeleton medals.

title: From pizza delivery man to Winter Olympics hopeful
partialText: A medallist with Team GB in 2014, bobsleigher Joel Fearon is preparing for his third Winter Olympics after coming out of retirement to compete for Jamaica.

title: Skier makes history for Brazil by winning gold in giant slalom
partialText: Lucas Pinheiro Braathen makes history for Brazil by clinching his nation's first Winter Olympic medal with gold in the giant slalom.

title: GB target skeleton team medal - Sunday's guide
partialText: What's happening and who to look out for at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina.

title: The spectacular multimillion-euro heist nobody noticed
partialText: The theft has left Germans with a strong sense that trust in institutions and the system has been shaken.

title: What the Nigella Lawson effect will mean for the Great British Bake Off
partialText: What joining Channel 4's famous tent could mean for the TV cook's career and the baking show.

title: How to get the best view of the Northern Lights in 2026
partialText: Experts say 2026 will be a peak year for aurora spotting as the Sun reaches the maximum of its cycle.

title: The saga of a Â£165m rail line that keeps causing travel chaos
partialText: Taxpayer money has flowed into fixing the rail line connecting Cornwall with the rest of the UK - but the elements have other ideas.

title: Is this a 'very Chinese time in your life'? The trend boosting China's soft power
partialText: Chinamaxxing is adding more gloss to the recent flourish of Chinese soft power.

title: An abduction, a Bitcoin demand and a TV icon - why Nancy Guthrie's case has gripped the US
partialText: Savannah Guthrie's fame has helped turn her mother's abduction into a national obsession.

title: The Papers: 'Navalny killed by frog toxin' and 'There must be probe into envoy Andrew'
partialText: A number of papers lead with the revelation that the Russian opposition leader was killed by a dart frog toxin.

title: Actor Ross Kemp to return to EastEnders for short stint
partialText: Kemp plays the infamous Grant Mitchell in the long-running soap.

title: Russia killed opposition leader Alexei Navalny using dart frog toxin, UK says
partialText: There is no innocent explanation for the toxin being found in samples taken from Navalny's body, Foreign Office says.

title: Man claimed girlfriend was killed in car crash, but forensics revealed the truth
partialText: Jenna Watkins was left on a remote mountain road by her boyfriend, who claimed she died in a crash.

title: Red eyes and black beaches: How one of the worst environmental disasters left its mark
partialText: A major oil spill which killed thousands of birds is still being debated, three decades later.

title: Boys have adventure of a lifetime filming Lord of the Flies
partialText: The cast say they made friends for life during the filming of the new BBC One series.

title: Father of Coronation Street star to climb Everest on behalf of son and other deaf children
partialText: Michael Woods says he is inspired by his actor son Joseph, who plays Aled Winter-Brown.

title: Somalian airline praises pilot for crash-landing faulty plane, saving all 55 on board
partialText: All 55 people on board survived after the plane failed to land on the runway near the shoreline.

title: Rare loggerhead turtle washes up on Suffolk beach during storm
partialText: The warm-water turtle is assessed and taken to a specialist centre for treatment.

title: Student beats seven other comedians to be crowned UK's pun champion
partialText: Adam Ernest Pickard beat seven other comedians to claim the 2026 title at the Leicester Comedy Festival.

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Sir Jim Ratcliffe Says Sorry (To Some) For 'Colonised' Comments

title: Has Jeff Bezos brought down the Washington Post?
partialText: The Amazon boss has gutted a third of the workforce at the iconic newspaper

title: Bewildering, bewitching, brilliant - Scotland's perfect day
partialText: Scotland were at their wildly entertaining best in the Calcutta Cup win over England. This was their perfect day, writes Tom English.

title: 'The officials looked petrified' - was Villa Park chaos advert for VAR?
partialText: Newcastle United beat Aston Villa in the FA Cup fourth round in a match dominated by a number of controversial decisions without VAR.

title: Three years on, Deulofeu is still fighting for 'miracle' return
partialText: Gerard Deulofeu has not played for more than three years but believes he can make "history" by fighting for a "miracle" comeback.

title: GB women stun curling world champions Canada and Muir into big air final
partialText: Great Britain's women curlers kickstart their campaign with a superb first victory of the 2026 Winter Olympics while GB's men also won but three British women missed out on skeleton medals.

title: Hodgkinson smashes own indoor record and sets sights on world best
partialText: Keely Hodgkinson says she is aiming for a new world record after breaking the British 800m mark at the UK Athletics Indoor Championships in Birmingham.

title: 'England have no chance at T20 World Cup if they do not improve'
partialText: England got back to winning ways against Scotland but their T20 World Cup hopes look slim unless there are significant improvements, writes Matthew Henry.

title: 'One of worst decisions I've ever seen' - Rooney on Digne handball
partialText: Wayne Rooney and Alan Shearer believe referees are "petrified" of making decisions without the "safety net of VAR", after the officials award a free-kick instead of a penalty despite Aston Villa's Lucas Digne handling the ball in the box.
